definition:
The class of all messages to a resource 
management program from one of its processes.

positive_examples: Feedback design ensured every user action received visible acknowledgment within 100ms.

opposite_reasoning: Command is the strongest practical opposite for Feedback in a control/process management context. While not a traditional antonym, it provides clear complementary opposition: Commands are directives sent TO processes (forward direction), while Feedback is information returned FROM processes (backward direction). This directional complementarity creates a meaningful semantic axis. Command has high availability (likely in both WordNet and SUMO), strong relevance for AI safety monitoring (understanding command-response cycles), and clear conceptual distinction. The Command↔Feedback axis would effectively separate concepts related to control initiation vs status reporting, which is valuable for analyzing AI system behavior and communication patterns.
